why_drink_other: My wife and I are both coffee professionals
I like hanging out in coffee shops
it's meditative and a great hobby
It's delicious and exciting in the way wine terroir and exploration is.
bonding experience with my wife and my other wife
Culturally interesting and makes great conversation
It's a cozy start to the morning
Good coffee is a way to make friends
to talk about common interest. To share beans you're excited about is splendid. And lastly
good coffee is what makes me excited to wake up the nest morning.
I don't really drink coffee much
Keeps me from drinking beer as it takes up that part of my monthly budget
It’s cold outside and I work in a garage
As a hobby and science- expanding my palette and trying new techniques/flavors is exciting
but I don’t drink coffee. However
I love to make coffee for my partner at home with the espresso machine and grinder.
Something to enjoy and share with my partner
I enjoy the aroma that fills the kitchen when it’s brewing
I don’t normally drink coffee. But I like trying new things and live with my partner who loves coffee.
It helps me center my focus and calm down.
I enjoy going to a cafe and getting lattes as a treat
For the metabolic and other salubrious benefits.
It’s a fun time with friends
I genuinely enjoy the process of brewing coffee
To fit in and sometimes as a change  (I'm an extreme bitter taster and find all coffee to be horribly bitter)
I trying to get into coffee and better my palette
My wife enjoys it and so I’ve fallen into the habit
my husband makes me try coffee every now and then
My partner makes it for me
I'm Cuban-American. It's in my DNA.
The smell and ritual remind me of simpler times.
it brings joy into my every day life.
To share the experience with my partner
All of the above and it’s a cue for me to be productive
It's a flavor hobby that isn't too expensive like fine dining and has no alcohol like wine and whiskey
Coffee for me is something so many people around the world partake in. I feel like part of that community when I make coffee for myself and others.
I like the ritual; something to look forward to
It's more enjoyable than water without the need for sugar and added flavoring.
It’s a way for my partner who loves coffee and I to bond and see out new experiences
I love the culture of it
I mostly like to drink coffee abroad when there's something unique to enjoy like filter coffee in south India
I like the caffeine but avoid having too much of it.
The technical challenge of mixing art and science to craft beverages is a worthwhile challenge and hobby... and part of my job.
but it's a nice side effect.
It’s just so much fun to try different brew methods and make delicious drinks.
I like the variety my local roaster offers
It provides a way of connecting with others
I like discovering flavors and the process of dialing in
To stick it to England and their unfair tea levy
It allows a zen moment in the day to take a break and enjoy something I love.
I enjoy the process of making a pour over coffee.
Love the culture and social aspects.
Aesthetic of going to a cafe
I like how it pairs with my morning oatmeal and other foods
like my healthy "cookies" and actual desserts. It is my favorite warm drink.
Chasing the dragon to make cafe quality cups at home
It is a key social setting for me
I don't drink coffee unless rarely when its a blended drink
then I drink it for taste
The design of the coffee apparati intrigues me.
the love that goes into it as a craft and as a way to make a living from the farmers all the way over to the baristas
Hydration (I water mine down a lot)
My husband makes coffee and I drink whatever he makes.
I have an exercise/writing routine that involves biking to cafés.
My son offers me taste of his often
Spouse enjoys coffee and wants to share with me
so occasional sips of their coffee is what I taste. Can’t do caffeine
and don’t care for the taste.
I like the culture and learning about it.
It gives me a community to chat with online about something I'm passionate about
or a café. Deep in your own thoughts
or enjoying a book to simply stop
and I drink it with him
Only drink coffee when my husband or a friend offers me a taste.
I really enjoy a hot mug of coffee in my hands.
typically when there are no good tea options
my husband enjoys coffee and I’ll try it with him. I also enjoy the experience of enjoying something at a coffee shop
but I am admittedly a tea gal not a coffee drinker.
I enjoy the process of making coffee
Having something to talk about with a friend
my partner is a long time coffee drinker
I started recently as something to do with her in the morning
